verses.text:
And Solomon the son of David was strengthened in his kingdom,
and the \nd LORD\nd* his God \add was\add* with him, and magnified
him exceedingly.

Then Solomon spake unto all Israel, to the captains of thousands
and of hundreds, and to the judges, and to every governor in all
Israel, the chief of the fathers.

So Solomon, and all the congregation with him, went to the high
place that \add was\add* at Gibeon; for there was the tabernacle
of the congregation of God, which Moses the servant of the \nd LORD\nd*
had made in the wilderness.

But the ark of God had David brought up from Kirjath-jearim to
\add the place which\add* David had prepared for it: for he had pitched
a tent for it at Jerusalem.

Moreover the brasen altar, that Bezaleel the son of Uri, the
son of Hur, had made, he put before the tabernacle of the \nd LORD\nd*:
and Solomon and the congregation sought unto it.\f + \fr 1.5  \ft he put: or, was
there\f*

And Solomon went up thither to the brasen altar before the
\nd LORD\nd*, which \add was\add* at the tabernacle of the congregation,
and offered a thousand burnt offerings upon it.

In that night did God appear unto Solomon, and said unto him,
Ask what I shall give thee.

And Solomon said unto God, Thou hast shewed great mercy unto
David my father, and hast made me to reign in his stead.

Now, O \nd LORD\nd* God, let thy promise unto David my father
be established: for thou hast made me king over a people like the
dust of the earth in multitude.\f + \fr 1.9  \ft like…: Heb. much as the dust of the
earth\f*

Give me now wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and come
in before this people: for who can judge this thy people, \add that is
so\add* great?

And God said to Solomon, Because this was in thine heart,
and thou hast not asked riches, wealth, or honour, nor the life of thine
enemies, neither yet hast asked long life; but hast asked wisdom
and knowledge for thyself, that thou mayest judge my people, over whom I have made thee
king:

Wisdom and knowledge \add is\add* granted unto thee; and I will
give thee riches, and wealth, and honour, such as none of the kings have had that
\add have been\add* before thee, neither shall there any after thee have the like.

Then Solomon came \add from his journey\add* to the high
place that \add was\add* at Gibeon to Jerusalem, from before the
tabernacle of the congregation, and reigned over Israel.

And Solomon gathered chariots and horsemen: and he had a thousand
and four hundred chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, which he
placed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.

And the king made silver and gold at Jerusalem \add as plenteous\add*
as stones, and cedar trees made he as the sycomore trees that \add are\add*
in the vale for abundance.\f + \fr 1.15  \ft made: Heb. gave\f*

And Solomon had horses brought out of Egypt, and linen yarn:
the king’s merchants received the linen yarn at a price.\f + \fr 1.16 
\ft Solomon…: Heb. the going forth of the horses which was Solomon’s\f*

And they fetched up, and brought forth out of Egypt a chariot
for six hundred \add shekels\add* of silver, and an horse for an
hundred and fifty: and so brought they out \add horses\add* for all the
kings of the Hittites, and for the kings of Syria, by their means.\f + \fr 1.17 
\ft means: Heb. hand\f*

And Solomon determined to build an house for the name of the
\nd LORD\nd*, and an house for his kingdom.

And Solomon told out threescore and ten thousand men to bear
burdens, and fourscore thousand to hew in the mountain, and three
thousand and six hundred to oversee them.

And Solomon sent to Huram the king of Tyre, saying, As thou didst
deal with David my father, and didst send him cedars to build him an
house to dwell therein, \add even so deal with me\add*.\f + \fr 2.3 
\ft Huram: or, Hiram\f*

Behold, I build an house to the name of the \nd LORD\nd* my
God, to dedicate \add it\add* to him, \add and\add* to burn before
him sweet incense, and for the continual shewbread, and for the burnt
offerings morning and evening, on the sabbaths, and on the new moons,
and on the solemn feasts of the \nd LORD\nd* our God. This \add is an
ordinance\add* for ever to Israel.\f + \fr 2.4  \ft sweet…: Heb. incense of
spices\f*

And the house which I build \add is\add* great: for great \add is\add*
our God above all gods.

But who is able to build him an house, seeing the heaven and
heaven of heavens cannot contain him? who \add am\add* I then, that I should
build him an house, save only to burn sacrifice before him?\f + \fr 2.6 
\ft is able: Heb. hath retained, or, obtained strength\f*

Send me now therefore a man cunning to work in gold, and in
silver, and in brass, and in iron, and in purple, and crimson, and
blue, and that can skill to grave with the cunning men that \add are\add*
with me in Judah and in Jerusalem, whom David my father did provide.\f + \fr 2.7 
\ft to grave: Heb. to grave gravings\f*

Send me also cedar trees, fir trees, and algum trees, out of
Lebanon: for I know that thy servants can skill to cut timber in
Lebanon; and, behold, my servants \add shall be\add* with thy servants,\f + \fr 2.8 
\ft algum: also called, almuggim\f*

Even to prepare me timber in abundance: for the house which I am about to
build \add shall be\add* wonderful great.\f + \fr 2.9  \ft wonderful…: Heb. great and
wonderful\f*

And, behold, I will give to thy servants, the hewers that
cut timber, twenty thousand measures of beaten wheat, and twenty
thousand measures of barley, and twenty thousand baths of wine, and
twenty thousand baths of oil.

Then Huram the king of Tyre answered in writing, which he
sent to Solomon, Because the \nd LORD\nd* hath loved his people,
he hath made thee king over them.

Huram said moreover, Blessed \add be\add* the \nd LORD\nd*
God of Israel, that made heaven and earth, who hath given to David
the king a wise son, endued with prudence and understanding, that might
build an house for the \nd LORD\nd*, and an house for his kingdom.\f + \fr 2.12 
\ft endued…: Heb. knowing prudence and understanding\f*

And now I have sent a cunning man, endued with understanding,
of Huram my father’s,

The son of a woman of the daughters of Dan, and his father
\add was\add* a man of Tyre, skilful to work in gold, and in silver,
in brass, in iron, in stone, and in timber, in purple, in blue, and in fine
linen, and in crimson; also to grave any manner of graving, and to find
out every device which shall be put to him, with thy cunning men,
and with the cunning men of my lord David thy father.

Now therefore the wheat, and the barley, the oil, and the
wine, which my lord hath spoken of, let him send unto his servants:

And we will cut wood out of Lebanon, as much as thou shalt
need: and we will bring it to thee in floats by sea to Joppa; and thou shalt carry it
up to Jerusalem.\f + \fr 2.16  \ft as much…: Heb according to all thy
need\f*\f + \fr 2.16  \ft Joppa: Heb. Japho\f*

And Solomon numbered all the strangers that \add were\add*
in the land of Israel, after the numbering wherewith David his father
had numbered them; and they were found an hundred and fifty thousand
and three thousand and six hundred.\f + \fr 2.17  \ft the strangers: Heb. the men the
strangers\f*

And he set threescore and ten thousand of them \add to be\add*
bearers of burdens, and fourscore thousand \add to be\add* hewers
in the mountain, and three thousand and six hundred overseers to
set the people a work.

Then Solomon began to build the house of the \nd LORD\nd* at
Jerusalem in mount Moriah, where \add the \+nd Lord\+nd*\add* appeared
unto David his father, in the place that David had prepared in the
threshingfloor of Ornan the Jebusite.\f + \fr 3.1  \ft where…: or, which was seen of David his
father\f*\f + \fr 3.1  \ft Ornan: also called, Araunah\f*

And he began to build in the second \add day\add* of the second
month, in the fourth year of his reign.

Now these \add are the things wherein\add* Solomon was instructed
for the building of the house of God. The length by cubits after the
first measure \add was\add* threescore cubits, and the breadth twenty
cubits.\f + \fr 3.3  \ft instructed: Heb. founded\f*

And the porch that \add was\add* in the front \add of the house\add*,
the length \add of it was\add* according to the breadth of the house,
twenty cubits, and the height \add was\add* an hundred and twenty:
and he overlaid it within with pure gold.

And the greater house he cieled with fir tree, which he overlaid
with fine gold, and set thereon palm trees and chains.

And he garnished the house with precious stones for beauty:
and the gold \add was\add* gold of Parvaim.\f + \fr 3.6  \ft garnished: Heb.
covered\f*

He overlaid also the house, the beams, the posts, and the walls
thereof, and the doors thereof, with gold; and graved cherubims on the
walls.

And he made the most holy house, the length whereof \add was\add*
according to the breadth of the house, twenty cubits, and the breadth
thereof twenty cubits: and he overlaid it with fine gold, \add amounting\add*
to six hundred talents.

And the weight of the nails \add was\add* fifty shekels of
gold. And he overlaid the upper chambers with gold.

And in the most holy house he made two cherubims of image
work, and overlaid them with gold.\f + \fr 3.10  \ft image…: or, (as some think) of moveable
work\f*

And the wings of the cherubims \add were\add* twenty cubits
long: one wing \add of the one cherub was\add* five cubits, reaching
to the wall of the house: and the other wing \add was likewise\add*
five cubits, reaching to the wing of the other cherub.

And \add one\add* wing of the other cherub \add was\add* five
cubits, reaching to the wall of the house: and the other wing \add was\add*
five cubits \add also\add*, joining to the wing of the other cherub.

The wings of these cherubims spread themselves forth twenty
cubits: and they stood on their feet, and their faces \add were\add*
inward.\f + \fr 3.13  \ft inward: or, toward the house\f*

And he made the vail \add of\add* blue, and purple, and crimson,
and fine linen, and wrought cherubims thereon.\f + \fr 3.14  \ft wrought: Heb. caused to
ascend\f*

Also he made before the house two pillars of thirty and five
cubits high, and the chapiter that \add was\add* on the top of each of them
\add was\add* five cubits.\f + \fr 3.15  \ft high: Heb. long\f*

And he made chains, \add as\add* in the oracle, and put \add them\add*
on the heads of the pillars; and made an hundred pomegranates, and
put \add them\add* on the chains.

And he reared up the pillars before the temple, one on the right
hand, and the other on the left; and called the name of that on the right
hand Jachin, and the name of that on the left Boaz.\f + \fr 3.17 
\ft Jachin: that is, He shall establish\f*\f + \fr 3.17  \ft Boaz: that is, In it is
strength\f*

Moreover he made an altar of brass, twenty cubits the length
thereof, and twenty cubits the breadth thereof, and ten cubits the
height thereof.

Also he made a molten sea of ten cubits from brim to brim,
round in compass, and five cubits the height thereof; and a line
of thirty cubits did compass it round about.\f + \fr 4.2  \ft from…: Heb. from his brim to his
brim\f*

And under it \add was\add* the similitude of oxen, which did
compass it round about: ten in a cubit, compassing the sea round
about. Two rows of oxen \add were\add* cast, when it was cast.

It stood upon twelve oxen, three looking toward the north,
and three looking toward the west, and three looking toward the south,
and three looking toward the east: and the sea \add was set\add*
above upon them, and all their hinder parts \add were\add* inward.

And the thickness of it \add was\add* an handbreadth, and the
brim of it like the work of the brim of a cup, with flowers of lilies;
\add and\add* it received and held three thousand baths.\f + \fr 4.5 
\ft with flowers…: or, like a lilyflower\f*

He made also ten lavers, and put five on the right hand, and
five on the left, to wash in them: such things as they offered for the burnt
offering they washed in them; but the sea \add was\add* for the priests
to wash in.\f + \fr 4.6  \ft such…: Heb. the work of burnt offering\f*

And he made ten candlesticks of gold according to their form,
and set \add them\add* in the temple, five on the right hand, and
five on the left.

He made also ten tables, and placed \add them\add* in the temple,
five on the right side, and five on the left. And he made an hundred
basons of gold.\f + \fr 4.8  \ft basons: or, bowls\f*

Furthermore he made the court of the priests, and the great
court, and doors for the court, and overlaid the doors of them with
brass.

And he set the sea on the right side of the east end, over
against the south.

And Huram made the pots, and the shovels, and the basons.
And Huram finished the work that he was to make for king Solomon
for the house of God;\f + \fr 4.11  \ft basons: or, bowls\f*\f + \fr 4.11 
\ft finished: Heb. finished to make\f*

\add To wit\add*, the two pillars, and the pommels, and the
chapiters \add which were\add* on the top of the two pillars, and the
two wreaths to cover the two pommels of the chapiters which \add were\add*
on the top of the pillars;

And four hundred pomegranates on the two wreaths; two rows
of pomegranates on each wreath, to cover the two pommels of the chapiters which
\add were\add* upon the pillars.\f + \fr 4.13  \ft upon: Heb. upon the face
of\f*

He made also bases, and lavers made he upon the bases;\f + \fr 4.14 
\ft lavers: or, caldrons\f*
One sea, and twelve oxen under it.

The pots also, and the shovels, and the fleshhooks, and all their
instruments, did Huram his father make to king Solomon for the house
of the \nd LORD\nd* of bright brass.\f + \fr 4.16  \ft bright: Heb. made bright, or,
scoured\f*

In the plain of Jordan did the king cast them, in the clay
ground between Succoth and Zeredathah.\f + \fr 4.17  \ft clay…: Heb. thicknesses of the
ground\f*

Thus Solomon made all these vessels in great abundance: for the
weight of the brass could not be found out.

And Solomon made all the vessels that \add were for\add*
the house of God, the golden altar also, and the tables whereon the
shewbread \add was set;\add*

Moreover the candlesticks with their lamps, that they should
burn after the manner before the oracle, of pure gold;

And the flowers, and the lamps, and the tongs, \add made he
of\add* gold, \add and\add* that perfect gold;\f + \fr 4.21  \ft perfect…: Heb. perfections of
gold\f*

And the snuffers, and the basons, and the spoons, and the
censers, \add of\add* pure gold: and the entry of the house, the
inner doors thereof for the most holy \add place\add*, and the doors
of the house of the temple, \add were of\add* gold.\f + \fr 4.22 
\ft basons: or, bowls\f*

Thus all the work that Solomon made for the house of the \nd LORD\nd*
was finished: and Solomon brought in \add all\add* the things that
David his father had dedicated; and the silver, and the gold, and all the
instruments, put he among the treasures of the house of God.

Then Solomon assembled the elders of Israel, and all the heads
of the tribes, the chief of the fathers of the children of Israel,
unto Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the covenant of the \nd LORD\nd*
out of the city of David, which \add is\add* Zion.

Wherefore all the men of Israel assembled themselves unto the
king in the feast which \add was\add* in the seventh month.

And all the elders of Israel came; and the Levites took up
the ark.

And they brought up the ark, and the tabernacle of the congregation,
and all the holy vessels that \add were\add* in the tabernacle, these did the
priests \add and\add* the Levites bring up.

Also king Solomon, and all the congregation of Israel that were
assembled unto him before the ark, sacrificed sheep and oxen, which could not be
told nor numbered for multitude.

And the priests brought in the ark of the covenant of the \nd LORD\nd*
unto his place, to the oracle of the house, into the most holy \add place,
even\add* under the wings of the cherubims:

For the cherubims spread forth \add their\add* wings over the
place of the ark, and the cherubims covered the ark and the staves
thereof above.

And they drew out the staves \add of the ark\add*, that the
ends of the staves were seen from the ark before the oracle; but they were not
seen without. And there it is unto this day.\f + \fr 5.9  \ft there…: or, they are
there\f*

\add There was\add* nothing in the ark save the two tables
which Moses put \add therein\add* at Horeb, when the \nd LORD\nd*
made \add a covenant\add* with the children of Israel, when they came
out of Egypt.\f + \fr 5.10  \ft when the \+nd LORD\+nd*: or, where,
etc\f*

And it came to pass, when the priests were come out of the
holy \add place:\add* (for all the priests \add that were\add* present
were sanctified, \add and\add* did not \add then\add* wait by course:\f + \fr 5.11 
\ft present: Heb. found\f*

Also the Levites \add which were\add* the singers, all of them of
Asaph, of Heman, of Jeduthun, with their sons and their brethren,
\add being\add* arrayed in white linen, having cymbals and psalteries
and harps, stood at the east end of the altar, and with them an hundred
and twenty priests sounding with trumpets:)

It came even to pass, as the trumpeters and singers \add were\add*
as one, to make one sound to be heard in praising and thanking the
\nd LORD\nd*; and when they lifted up \add their\add* voice with the
trumpets and cymbals and instruments of musick, and praised the \nd LORD\nd*,
\add saying\add*, For \add he is\add* good; for his mercy \add endureth\add*
for ever: that \add then\add* the house was filled with a cloud,
\add even\add* the house of the \nd LORD\nd*;

So that the priests could not stand to minister by reason
of the cloud: for the glory of the \nd LORD\nd* had filled the house
of God.

Then said Solomon, The \nd LORD\nd* hath said that he would
dwell in the thick darkness.

But I have built an house of habitation for thee, and a place
for thy dwelling for ever.

And the king turned his face, and blessed the whole congregation
of Israel: and all the congregation of Israel stood.

And he said, Blessed \add be\add* the \nd LORD\nd* God of Israel,
who hath with his hands fulfilled \add that\add* which he spake with his
mouth to my father David, saying,

Since the day that I brought forth my people out of the land
of Egypt I chose no city among all the tribes of Israel to build
an house in, that my name might be there; neither chose I any man
to be a ruler over my people Israel:

But I have chosen Jerusalem, that my name might be there; and have
chosen David to be over my people Israel.

Now it was in the heart of David my father to build an house
for the name of the \nd LORD\nd* God of Israel.

But the \nd LORD\nd* said to David my father, Forasmuch as it was in thine
heart to build an house for my name, thou didst well in that it was in thine
heart:

Notwithstanding thou shalt not build the house; but thy son
which shall come forth out of thy loins, he shall build the house
for my name.

The 
d LORD
d* therefore hath performed his word that he hath
spoken: for I am risen up in the room of David my father, and am
set on the throne of Israel, as the 
d LORD
d* promised, and have
built the house for the name of the 
d LORD
d* God of Israel.

And in it have I put the ark, wherein \add is\add* the covenant
of the \nd LORD\nd*, that he made with the children of Israel.

And he stood before the altar of the \nd LORD\nd* in the presence of all the
congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands:

For Solomon had made a brasen scaffold, of five cubits long,
and five cubits broad, and three cubits high, and had set it in the
midst of the court: and upon it he stood, and kneeled down upon his
knees before all the congregation of Israel, and spread forth his
hands toward heaven,\f + \fr 6.13  \ft long…: Heb. the length thereof,
etc\f*

And said, O \nd LORD\nd* God of Israel, \add there is\add*
no God like thee in the heaven, nor in the earth; which keepest covenant, and
\add shewest\add* mercy unto thy servants, that walk before thee with all their
hearts:

Thou which hast kept with thy servant David my father that which thou hast
promised him; and spakest with thy mouth, and hast fulfilled \add it\add*
with thine hand, as \add it is\add* this day.

Now therefore, O \nd LORD\nd* God of Israel, keep with thy
servant David my father that which thou hast promised him, saying,
There shall not fail thee a man in my sight to sit upon the throne
of Israel; yet so that thy children take heed to their way to walk
in my law, as thou hast walked before me.\f + \fr 6.16  \ft There…: Heb. There shall not a man be cut
off\f*

Now then, O \nd LORD\nd* God of Israel, let thy word be verified,
which thou hast spoken unto thy servant David.

But will God in very deed dwell with men on the earth? behold,
heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this
house which I have built!

Have respect therefore to the prayer of thy servant, and to his
supplication, O \nd LORD\nd* my God, to hearken unto the cry and the
prayer which thy servant prayeth before thee:

That thine eyes may be open upon this house day and night,
upon the place whereof thou hast said that thou wouldest put thy
name there; to hearken unto the prayer which thy servant prayeth
toward this place.\f + \fr 6.20  \ft toward…: or, in this place\f*

Hearken therefore unto the supplications of thy servant, and of thy
people Israel, which they shall make toward this place: hear thou from thy
dwelling place, \add even\add* from heaven; and when thou hearest,
forgive.\f + \fr 6.21  \ft make: Heb. pray\f*\f + \fr 6.21  \ft toward…: or, in this
place\f*

If a man sin against his neighbour, and an oath be laid upon him to make him
swear, and the oath come before thine altar in this house;\f + \fr 6.22 
\ft and an oath…: Heb. and he require an oath of him\f*

And if thy people Israel be put to the worse before the enemy,
because they have sinned against thee; and shall return and confess
thy name, and pray and make supplication before thee in this house;\f + \fr 6.24 
\ft be put…: or, be smitten\f*\f + \fr 6.24  \ft in: or, toward\f*

Then hear thou from the heavens, and forgive the sin of thy
people Israel, and bring them again unto the land which thou gavest
to them and to their fathers.

When the heaven is shut up, and there is no rain, because they have
sinned against thee; \add yet\add* if they pray toward this place,
and confess thy name, and turn from their sin, when thou dost afflict
them;\f + \fr 6.26  \ft toward…: or, in this place\f*

Then hear thou from heaven, and forgive the sin of thy servants,
and of thy people Israel, when thou hast taught them the good way,
wherein they should walk; and send rain upon thy land, which thou hast
given unto thy people for an inheritance.

If there be dearth in the land, if there be pestilence, if there be
blasting, or mildew, locusts, or caterpillers; if their enemies besiege
them in the cities of their land; whatsoever sore or whatsoever sickness
\add there be:\add*\f + \fr 6.28  \ft in the cities…: Heb. in the land of their
gates\f*

\add Then\add* what prayer \add or\add* what supplication
soever shall be made of any man, or of all thy people Israel, when every
one shall know his own sore and his own grief, and shall spread forth
his hands in this house:\f + \fr 6.29  \ft in: or, toward\f*\f + \fr 6.29 
\ft toward…: or, in this place\f*

Then hear thou from heaven thy dwelling place, and forgive,
and render unto every man according unto all his ways, whose heart
thou knowest; (for thou only knowest the hearts of the children of
men:)

That they may fear thee, to walk in thy ways, so long as they
live in the land which thou gavest unto our fathers.\f + \fr 6.31 
\ft so long…: Heb. all the days which\f*\f + \fr 6.31  \ft in the land: Heb. upon the face of the
land\f*

Moreover concerning the stranger, which is not of thy people
Israel, but is come from a far country for thy great name’s sake, and thy
mighty hand, and thy stretched out arm; if they come and pray in this
house;\f + \fr 6.32  \ft toward…: or, in this place\f*

Then hear thou from the heavens, \add even\add* from thy dwelling
place, and do according to all that the stranger calleth to thee for; that all
people of the earth may know thy name, and fear thee, as \add doth\add*
thy people Israel, and may know that this house which I have built
is called by thy name.\f + \fr 6.33  \ft this…: Heb. thy name is called upon this
house\f*

If thy people go out to war against their enemies by the way
that thou shalt send them, and they pray unto thee toward this city
which thou hast chosen, and the house which I have built for thy
name;

Then hear thou from the heavens their prayer and their supplication,
and maintain their cause.\f + \fr 6.35  \ft cause: or, right\f*

If they sin against thee, (for \add there is\add* no man which
sinneth not,) and thou be angry with them, and deliver them over
before \add their\add* enemies, and they carry them away captives
unto a land far off or near;\f + \fr 6.36  \ft they carry them away captives: Heb. they that take them captives carry them
away\f*

Yet \add if\add* they bethink themselves in the land whither they are carried
captive, and turn and pray unto thee in the land of their captivity,
saying, We have sinned, we have done amiss, and have dealt wickedly;\f + \fr 6.37 
\ft bethink…: Heb. bring back to their heart\f*

If they return to thee with all their heart and with all their
soul in the land of their captivity, whither they have carried them
captives, and pray toward their land, which thou gavest unto their
fathers, and \add toward\add* the city which thou hast chosen, and toward the
house which I have built for thy name:

Then hear thou from the heavens, \add even\add* from thy dwelling
place, their prayer and their supplications, and maintain their cause,
and forgive thy people which have sinned against thee.\f + \fr 6.39 
\ft cause: or, right\f*

Now, my God, let, I beseech thee, thine eyes be open, and
\add let\add* thine ears \add be\add* attent unto the prayer \add that is
made\add* in this place.\f + \fr 6.40  \ft unto…: Heb. to the prayer of this
place\f*

Now therefore arise, O 
d LORD
d* God, into thy resting
place, thou, and the ark of thy strength: let thy priests, O 
d LORD
